meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Pat Greiner Brad Shumel David Gatewood Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7505.

td.p: Pat Greiner, a radio copywriter and voiceover announcer from Casper, Wyoming
Brad Shumel, a pharmaceutical medical director from Chappaqua, New York
David Gatewood, a Ph.D. student from Knoxville, Tennessee (whose 1-day cash winnings total $21,600)

tr.td: (Sarah: Established in 1904, its members have inspired fellow adventurers while sharing with all of us the wonders of our world.)

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', '[Alex reads the clue as "Her and Mindy".]
...
(Alex: Yeah. [Looking to judges] Did I say "her"? How silly of me. I changed his--well, we won\'t get into that. I\'m not a well person. Dave, go again.)

Mork

David
')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', '"____ & Mindy"')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_1', 'clue_J_6_1_stuck', '(Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from the Explorers Club in New York.) Using the Explorers Club globe, this Norwegian planned an expedition to show that South Americans could\'ve settled Polynesia as early as 500 A.D.; on August 7, 1947, his balsa wood raft reached Raroia Atoll after 101 hazardous days at sea, proving his theory')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from the Explorers Club in New York.) Using the Explorers Club globe, this Norwegian planned an expedition to show that South Americans could've settled Polynesia as early as 500 A.D.; on August 7, 1947, his balsa wood raft reached Raroia Atoll after 101 hazardous days at sea, proving his theory

Past presidents of the Explorers Club include Roy Chapman Andrews, who\'s said to be the real life inspiration for Indiana Jones; Andrews gained fame in the 1920s with his discoveries of fossilized dinosaur eggs in this Mongolian desert')

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from the Explorers Club in New York.) Past presidents of the Explorers Club include Roy Chapman Andrews, who's said to be the real life inspiration for Indiana Jones; Andrews gained fame in the 1920s with his discoveries of fossilized dinosaur eggs in this Mongolian desert

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_3', 'clue_J_6_3_stuck', '(Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from the explorers club in New York.) Explorers club meetings begin with the ringing of this bell from one of the ships that in 1884 rescued the club\'s future first president Adolphus Greely & six surviving crew members; all were near death, having been stranded for three years on this large island 16 miles west of Greenland')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from the explorers club in New York.) Explorers club meetings begin with the ringing of this bell from one of the ships that in 1884 rescued the club's future first president Adolphus Greely & six surviving crew members; all were near death, having been stranded for three years on this large island 16 miles west of Greenland

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_5', 'clue_J_6_5_stuck', '(Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from the Explorers Club in New York.) Using this radio transmitter to keep in contact with his base camp, this admiral left camp on the afternoon of November 28, 1929, & flew south; around 9 hours later, he & his crew became the first to fly over the South Pole')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from the Explorers Club in New York.) Using this radio transmitter to keep in contact with his base camp, this admiral left camp on the afternoon of November 28, 1929, & flew south; around 9 hours later, he & his crew became the first to fly over the South Pole

div.h3: Scores at the first commercial break (after clue 15):
Scores at the end of the Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: (Alex: ...there will be five responses that begin with the letter H.)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_DJ_1_1', 'clue_DJ_1_1_stuck', 'In 2015 researchers workin\' "9 to 5" honored the Appalachian roots of this singer by naming a local lichen for her')

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_DJ_2_2', 'clue_DJ_2_2_stuck', '(I\'m Chuck Todd.) Someone I would have loved to interview on "Meet the Press"\' is this president who left office in 1861 & left the nation on the brink of civil war--where did it all go wrong?')

tr.td: (I'm Chuck Todd.) Someone I would have loved to interview on "Meet the Press"' is this president who left office in 1861 & left the nation on the brink of civil war--where did it all go wrong?

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '[After Final Jeopardy!, the Smurfs jump, cheer, bump chests, dance, and celebrate in front of the contestant lecterns.]
BradWhat is ?
$3,300
PatWhat is A Room With a View?
$7,000
DavidWhat is Jamaica Inn
$10,000
A Room with a View')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'The title of this 1908 novel is an allusion to the hotel in Florence where the novel starts & ends the next year')

tr.td: The title of this 1908 novel is an allusion to the hotel in Florence where the novel starts & ends the next year

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law. This website is not affiliated with, sponsored by, or operated by Jeopardy Productions, Inc. Join the discussion at JBoard.tv.
